intro: Castalia elegans, commonly known as the elegant castalia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant features lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture and produces vibrant, tubular flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow. Castalia elegans thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
